revised_title: Quantum Electrodynamical Theory of Differential Scattering
tldr: The authors developed a quantum electrodynamical theory of differential scattering based on a two-chromophore model. They applied this theory to the process of differential Rayleigh scattering of circularly polarized light, calculating differential scattered intensities and analyzing their near- and far-zone behavior. The study has implications for understanding the optical properties of chiral molecules and systems with dissymmetric chromophore arrangements.
